meanings.definition: Lacking in propriety or good taste
meanings.sent1: She made an indelicate comment at the dinner table.
meanings.sent2: It is considered indelicate to speak loudly in a library.
meanings.sent3: His indelicate joke caused everyone to laugh.
meanings.sent4: The painting's colors clashed in an indelicate manner.
meanings.sent5: The smell from the garbage can was truly indelicate.

meanings.definition: Not delicate in feeling or manner
meanings.sent1: Her indelicate handling of the fragile vase led to its breakage.
meanings.sent2: He was known for his indelicate way of speaking.
meanings.sent3: The indelicate way he danced made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The storm's indelicate winds knocked over the trees.
meanings.sent5: The chef's indelicate chopping resulted in uneven pieces of vegetables.

meanings.sent1: The indelicate stitching on the dress made it look messy.
meanings.sent2: The indelicate construction of the toy caused it to fall apart easily.
meanings.sent3: The indelicate drawing of the house made it look like a child's artwork.
meanings.sent4: The indelicate design of the building lacked elegance.
meanings.sent5: The indelicate brush strokes ruined the artist's masterpiece.
